help.short: The name of the Firewall Policy.
Expands referenced resources. Default value is None.
The name of the Firewall Policy.
The name of the Firewall Policy.
Location. Values from: `az account list-locations`. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=<location>`.
The name or ID of parent firewall policy from which rules are inherited.
SKU of Firewall policy.
A flag to indicate if SQL Redirect traffic filtering is enabled.
The operation mode for Threat Intelligence.
Space-separated tags: key[=value] [key[=value] ...]. Use "" to clear existing tags.
Enable DNS Proxy.
Space-separated list of DNS server IP addresses.
FQDNs in Network Rules are supported when set to true.
Explicit Proxy Settings definition.
When set to true, explicit proxy mode is enabled.
When set to true, pac file port and url needs to be provided.
Port number for explicit proxy http protocol, cannot be greater than 64000.
Port number for explicit proxy https protocol, cannot be greater than 64000.
SAS URL for PAC file.
Port number for firewall to serve PAC file.

The type of identity used for the resource. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the virtual machine.

The list of user identities associated with resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.
Intrusion detection configuration properties.
List of rules for traffic to bypass.
Description of the bypass traffic rule.
List of destination IP addresses or ranges for this rule.
List of destination IpGroups for this rule.
List of destination ports or ranges.
Name of the bypass traffic rule.
The rule bypass protocol.
List of source IP addresses or ranges for this rule.
List of source IpGroups for this rule.

IDPS Private IP address ranges are used to identify traffic direction (i.e. inbound, outbound, etc.). By default, only ranges defined by IANA RFC 1918 are considered private IP addresses. To modify default ranges, specify your Private IP address ranges with this property
List of specific signatures states.
Signature id.
The signature state.
IDPS mode.
Resource ID.
Insights on Firewall Policy.
A flag to indicate if the insights are enabled on the policy.
Workspaces needed to configure the Firewall Policy Insights.
The default workspace Id for Firewall Policy Insights.
Resource ID.
List of workspaces for Firewall Policy Insights.
Region to configure the Workspace.
The workspace Id for Firewall Policy Insights.
Number of days the insights should be enabled on the policy.
The operation mode for automatically learning private ranges to not be SNAT
List of private IP addresses/IP address ranges to not be SNAT.
Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) Secret or Certificate object stored in KeyVault.
Name of the CA certificate.
Space-separated list of FQDNs.
Space-separated list of IPv4 addresses.
